oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SINGULARITIES IN MECHANISMS - THE LOCAL TRAJECTORY TRACKING PROBLEM
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SHANKAR, S
SARAF, A
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper is concerned with the problem of a mechanism tracking a trajectory that passes through a singularity (i.e. a critical value of the forward map of the mechanism). The following phenomenon can occur-while the mechanism cannot track the given trajectory, it can however track a reparametrized version by pausing at the singularity. Several mechanisms are considered that exhibit this phenomenon. Some of these mechanisms are studied via groups of symmetries of the mechanism. One example uses such symmetries to describe the singularities of an orthogonal 3-axis wrist.
